thread.title: Business Intelligence Vendor Yellowfin to Sponsor TDWI San Diego 2015
thread.title_full: Business Intelligence Vendor Yellowfin to Sponsor TDWI San Diego 2015

title: Business Intelligence Vendor Yellowfin to Sponsor TDWI San Diego 2015
text: Business Intelligence Vendor Yellowfin to Sponsor TDWI San Diego 2015 , 10 September 2015 -- Global Business Intelligence (BI) and analytics software vendor, Yellowfin, has announced that it will be exhibiting at The Data Warehousing Institute’s (TDWI) 2015 San Diego World Conference as a ‘gold’ event sponsor.San Diego, CA, USA, September 10, 2015 -- TDWI’s San Diego World Conference will be held across 20 – 25 September 2015, at the Manchester Grand Hyatt, San Diego (One Market Place, San Diego, CA 92101). The event provides BI, Data Warehousing (DW) and analytics professional with “end-to-end coverage of the most important and complex topics, skills, and disciplines that are essential to succeed in today’s data-driven world of business”. TDWI San Diego also provides an opportunity for leading BI, DW and analytics solutions to showcase their capabilities. As an event sponsor, Yellowfin will be demonstrating its BI solution, exhibiting at booth number 202. For more information, and to register for TDWI’s San Diego World Conference, GO HERE: https://events.tdwi.org/events/san-diego-2015/home.aspx “TDWI San Diego delivers delegates the depth and breadth of knowledge and hands-on experience needed to develop coherent enterprise data strategies – from traditional structured data to Big Data, and from reporting to advanced analytics,” said Yellowfin General Manager for North America, Justin Wright. “TDWI San Diego provides attendees with the ability to understand, organize, integrate and apply the ever-expanding array of data techniques, tools and technologies in a cohesive data strategy.” The agenda for TDWI’s 2015 San Diego conference comprises 60 sessions across nine streams, focusing on ‘Leading in a Data-Driven Organization’, ‘Data Analytics’, ‘Big Data’, ‘Data Visualization’, ‘Data Modeling and Management’, ‘Data Warehousing and BI’, ‘Tools and Technologies’, as well as case study and keynote presentations. The keynote sessions for TDWI San Diego 2015 are titled Elevating Your Data Platform, Philosophy, Pragmatism and Practices and Implementing Predictive Analytics Programs: What’s Possible?. The first will be delivered by Data Platform Director at Netflix, Kurt Brown. Mike Lampa, Managing Partner at Denver-based BI and advanced analytics consultancy, Archipelago Information Strategies, will present the second. View the full agenda for TDWI San Diego 2015 HERE: https://events.tdwi.org/Events/San-Diego-2015/Tracks/Track-List.aspx TDWI’s conference event in San Diego, California, is the fourth of its conference series for 2015. TDWI’s annual series of conference tradeshows provide a forum for business and technology professionals looking to gain in-depth education on BI, DW and analytics. Yellowfin will exhibit at all five TDWI conference events throughout 2015. For details, and to register for a 2015 TDWI conference, GO HERE: https://tdwi.org/calendar/event-calendar-conferences.aspx About Yellowfin: Yellowfin is a global Business Intelligence (BI) and analytics software vendor passionate about making BI easy. Founded in 2003 in response to the complexity and costs associated with implementing and using traditional BI tools, Yellowfin is a highly intuitive 100 percent Web-based reporting and analytics solution. Yellowfin is a leader in mobile, collaborative and embedded BI as well as Location Intelligence and data visualization. Over 10,000 organizations, and more than one million end-users across 70 different countries, use Yellowfin every day. For more information, visit http://www.yellowfinbi.com For regular news and updates, follow Yellowfin on Twitter (@YellowfinBI), LinkedIn (Yellowfin Business Intelligence), YouTube (Yellowfin Team) or email to subscribe to Yellowfin’s free e-newsletter. For further media information, interviews, images or product demonstration, please contact: Lachlan James, Yellowfin Global Communications Manager on +61 (0)3 8617 4954, +61 (0)431 835 658 or Contact:
